thread.title: EKU's Spence added to FCS Defensive Player of the Year watch list
thread.title_full: EKU's Spence added to FCS Defensive Player of the Year watch list

title: EKU's Spence added to FCS Defensive Player of the Year watch list
text:
EKU's Spence added to FCS Defensive Player of the Year watch list Posted: Fri 2:54 PM, Oct 09, 2015 / Headlines List / Article 
RICHMOND, Ky. – Eastern Kentucky University redshirt junior Noah Spence was added to the STATS FCS Defensive Player of the Year Watch List on Wednesday. 
Three players were added on Wednesday to expand the list to a total of 25 defensive players from across the Football Championship Subdivision (FCS). 
Spence, a transfer from Ohio State, leads EKU with 5.5 sacks, 8.5 tackles for a loss, five quarterback hurries and is tied for the team lead with 24 tackles. The 6-foot-3 defensive end has had at least one sack in each of Eastern’s five games. He began this week ranked ninth in the nation in sacks per game and 17th in FCS with 1.6 tackles for a loss per game. 
Spence started 13 games for the Buckeyes at defensive end in 2013 and was named first-team all-Big Ten (media). He ranked second in the Big Ten in sacks (8) and sixth in tackles-for-loss (14.5).
